com.radiotelescope.security

Class UserContextImpl

  • com.radiotelescope.security.UserContextImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserContext

    public class UserContextImpl
implements UserContext

    Concrete implementation of interface UserContext interface that uses Spring Security to validate if a user has the ability to execute an action or not

    This is declared as a Component with a Bean value of "UserContext" so that it can be autowired by Spring when the application runs, allowing for the class Logger service to be instantiated automatically. This is very important because it allows us to use the class FakeUserContext with the class Logger so it can still be tested

    See Also:
    interface UserContext, class Logger, class FakeUserContext, class Logger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserContextImpl(IUserRepository userRepo, IUserRoleRepository userRoleRepo, RetrieveAuthService retrieveAuthService)
      Concrete implementation of interface UserContext interface that uses Spring Security to validate if a user has the ability to execute an action or not

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Long currentUserId()
      Override of the UserContext.currentUserId method that will grab the authentication token if it exists and return the userId, otherwise it will return null
      <S,E> SecuredAction<S,E> require(java.util.List<? extends com.radiotelescope.repository.role.UserRole.Role> requiredRoles, Command<? extends S,? extends E> successCommand)
      Override of the UserContext.require method that uses Spring Security to check if a user has all of the roles in the requiredRoles parameter. If they do, it will call the success command. If not, it will return the list of missing roles
      <S,E> SecuredAction<S,E> requireAny(java.util.List<? extends com.radiotelescope.repository.role.UserRole.Role> requiredRoles, Command<? extends S,? extends E> successCommand)
      Override of the UserContext.requireAny method that uses Spring Security to check if a user has any of the roles in the requiredRoles parameter. If they do, it will call the success command. If not, it will return a list of the missing roles

      • Methods inherited from interface com.radiotelescope.security.UserContext

        currentUserId, require, requireAny
